Netta.Connection

Class Connection

extends java.lang.Object

    • Method Detail

      • openIOStreams

        public void openIOStreams()
                   throws ConnectionInitializationException
        Starts the connection and it's objects. Initializes Input and Output streams, and sets Connection Active to true only if no exception is thrown
        Throws:
        ConnectionInitializationException - if there is an error creating client input and/or output streams

      • closeIOStreams

        public void closeIOStreams()
                    throws ConnectionException
        Closes the Input and Output streams Sets the active boolean value to false regardless if there is an exception. This is to ensure the IO objects are no longer used if there is an error
        Throws:
        ConnectionException - if there is an issue closing the connection streams or connected socket. Details are in the exception object's message(). If an error is thrown, force close the connection.

      • isConnectionActive

        public boolean isConnectionActive()
        Check whether the connection is still active or not
        Returns:
        True if the connection is still active, else false;

      • sendPacket

        public boolean sendPacket(Packet p,
                          boolean encrypted)
                   throws SendPacketException
        Send Packet. This method sends a packet p to the connected socket. It is important to note that this send is NOT converted to bytes, it is only sent as a packet. This function cannot be called if the connection is not active.
        Parameters:
        p - packet being sent to the socket connection
        encrypted - boolean value, whether the packet will be encrypted or not
        Returns:
        boolean value based on the success of the send. True if object sent successfully, else false.
        Throws:
        SendPacketException - thrown when there is an error creating or sending a packet to the socket. Details in the exception object's message()

      • receivePacket

        public Packet receivePacket(boolean encrypted)
                     throws ReadPacketException
        Read Packet. This method reads a packet from the connected sockets input stream. It is important to note, this method reads the Packet object DIRECTLY, there is no byte conversion. This function cannot be called if the connection is not active.
        Parameters:
        encrypted - boolean value, whether the packet will be encrypted or not
        Returns:
        packet from the sockets input stream. If there is an error or anything else goes wrong, returns Packet.PACKET_TYPE.NULL packet
        Throws:
        ReadPacketException - thrown when there is an error reading a packet from the socket. Details in the exception object's message()
